intro: Pasania papuana, commonly known as the Papuan pasania, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
